Pre-Game Insights: Guyana has conceded ten goals in its last five matches, the visiting team needs to avoid conceding more.
Martinique comes in after two wins, the same number of draws and one loss, so they will be looking to return to winning ways and give their home fans something to cheer about.
Guyana comes into this game with four defeats in the last five matches played, the only match won was against Belize, where they won three goals to one.
Kevin Appin is the player Guyana needs to pay special attention to.
Both Guyana and Martinique have not managed to win, in addition to that, they come to this game with three goals conceded in the first game alone, a situation they will be looking to reverse.

Jamaal Shabazz spoke ahead of this match: “I felt like we were always in the game. When we made the two substitutions in the middle, we had the chance with the go-ahead goal. At this level of the game, when you don’t take your chances to go ahead and you give them away, you’re going to be punished; and I think we learned that lesson today.”
Marc Collat ​​is already ready to welcome Guyana in this second duel, a great turnout is expected and a lot of support for the home team who will go all out to get the win.
Guyana also failed to score in its first match and ended up losing to Surinam three goals to one, the visiting team will go all out to score three.
Martinique failed to beat Guatemala in its first game and fell three goals to one, in this match it will seek to score three against this rival that will not be easy either.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match corresponding to the second day of the CONCACAF Nations League cannot be seen in USA territory.
It is at 20:00 hrs, (Mexico) that these teams will face each other, however we leave you the schedules of different countries.
The match will be played at the Pierre-Aliker Municipal Stadium.
Martinique and Guyana will meet for the second time in their history, in the first game, played in 2017, in that match everything ended goalless, besides being friendly.
Others: The CONCACAF Nations League match between Martinique and Guyana was a thrilling match with both teams scoring two goals each.
